laboratory_examinations.findings: Poorly defined opacity in the basal right lung, signs of reduced volume secondary to lobar atelectasis, effacement of the ipsilateral costophrenic angle due to moderate pleural effusion, elevation of the right diaphragm due to a right thoracostomy tube.

Biatrial enlargement (left atrium 44 m1/m2, right atrium 35 m1/m2), left ventricle of usual size and morphology without segmental contractility disorders, preserved systolic function (LVEF 65%). Right cardiac chambers enlarged with preserved right ventricle systolic function and signs of volume overload, massive functional tricuspid insufficiency (ERO 0.72 cm2, 70 ml regurgitating volume), and Gerbode type defect observed.
Satisfactory closure of the tricuspid valve and Gerbode's defect.
